title: Watts & Close & Paulson in Divorce Attorneys Series 'All's Fair' Teaser
description: "What do you ladies think you could possibly hit me with that I haven't seen before?" Hulu has unveiled a wild first look teaser trailer for a series titled All's Fair, yet another new Ryan Murphy creation. This is set for release in the fall later this year - but they're starting to hype it up already. The brash and opulent series follows a successful divorce lawyer and the owner of an all-female law firm in Los Angeles. A team of female divorce attorneys leave a male-dominated firm to open their own powerhouse practice. Fierce, brilliant and emotionally complicated, they navigate high-stakes breakups, scandalous secrets and shifting allegiancesâ€”both in the courtroom and within their own ranks. The new series stars Kim Kardashian, Naomi Watts, Niecy Nash-Betts, Teyana Taylor, Matthew Noszka, with Sarah Paulson and Glenn Close. This is obviously a spicy trailer with all kinds of crazy things going on to get your attention and make you go "what is this?!" Don't fall for it! These lawyers are coming for you (and all your money) whether you like it or not. Here's the teaser trailer (+ poster) for Ryan Murphy's series All's Fair, direct from Hulu's YouTube: ðŸ–‹ "Lawyers are [â€¦]

text: TRAILERS by May 13, 2025Source: YouTube "What do you ladies think you could possibly hit me with that I haven't seen before?" Hulu has unveiled a wild first look teaser trailer for a series titled All's Fair, yet another new Ryan Murphy creation. This is set for release in the fall later this year - but they're starting to hype it up already. The brash and opulent series follows a successful divorce lawyer and the owner of an all-female law firm in Los Angeles. A team of female divorce attorneys leave a male-dominated firm to open their own powerhouse practice. Fierce, brilliant and emotionally complicated, they navigate high-stakes breakups, scandalous secrets and shifting allegiancesâ€”both in the courtroom and within their own ranks. The new series stars Kim Kardashian, Naomi Watts, Niecy Nash-Betts, Teyana Taylor, Matthew Noszka, with Sarah Paulson and Glenn Close. This is obviously a spicy trailer with all kinds of crazy things going on to get your attention and make you go "what is this?!" Don't fall for it! These lawyers are coming for you (and all your money) whether you like it or not. Here's the teaser trailer (+ poster) for Ryan Murphy's series All's Fair, direct from Hulu's YouTube: ðŸ–‹ "Lawyers are a girl's best friend." A team of female divorce attorneys leave a male-dominated firm to open their own powerhouse practice. Fierce, brilliant, and emotionally complicated, they navigate high-stakes breakups, scandalous secrets, and shifting allegiancesâ€”both in the courtroom and within their own ranks. In a world where money talks and love is a battleground, these women donâ€™t just play the gameâ€”they change it. All's Fair is a series created by Jon Robin Baitz and Joe Baken and Ryan Murphy. It's written and executive produced by Ryan Murphy, who also directs, Jon Robin Baitz, Joe Baken, Jamie Pachino, Lyn Greene and Richard Levine. With episodes directed by Murphy, Anthony Hemingway, and Crystle Roberson Dorsey. Produced by 20th Television in association with Ryan Murphy TV. Also executive produced by Anthony Hemingway, Kris Jenner, Alexis Martin Woodall, Eric Kovtun, Scott Robertson, Nissa Diederich. Hulu will debut the All's Fair series streaming on Hulu starting in fall 2025. Stay tuned for the final date. Find more posts in: Streaming, To Watch, Trailer prev next

TRAILERS

by
May 13, 2025
Source: YouTube

"What do you ladies think you could possibly hit me with that I haven't seen before?" Hulu has unveiled a wild first look teaser trailer for a series titled All's Fair, yet another new Ryan Murphy creation. This is set for release in the fall later this year - but they're starting to hype it up already. The brash and opulent series follows a successful divorce lawyer and the owner of an all-female law firm in Los Angeles. A team of female divorce attorneys leave a male-dominated firm to open their own powerhouse practice. Fierce, brilliant and emotionally complicated, they navigate high-stakes breakups, scandalous secrets and shifting allegiancesâ€”both in the courtroom and within their own ranks. The new series stars Kim Kardashian, Naomi Watts, Niecy Nash-Betts, Teyana Taylor, Matthew Noszka, with Sarah Paulson and Glenn Close. This is obviously a spicy trailer with all kinds of crazy things going on to get your attention and make you go "what is this?!" Don't fall for it! These lawyers are coming for you (and all your money) whether you like it or not.

Here's the teaser trailer (+ poster) for Ryan Murphy's series All's Fair, direct from Hulu's YouTube:

ðŸ–‹ "Lawyers are a girl's best friend." A team of female divorce attorneys leave a male-dominated firm to open their own powerhouse practice. Fierce, brilliant, and emotionally complicated, they navigate high-stakes breakups, scandalous secrets, and shifting allegiancesâ€”both in the courtroom and within their own ranks. In a world where money talks and love is a battleground, these women donâ€™t just play the gameâ€”they change it. All's Fair is a series created by Jon Robin Baitz and Joe Baken and Ryan Murphy. It's written and executive produced by Ryan Murphy, who also directs, Jon Robin Baitz, Joe Baken, Jamie Pachino, Lyn Greene and Richard Levine. With episodes directed by Murphy, Anthony Hemingway, and Crystle Roberson Dorsey. Produced by 20th Television in association with Ryan Murphy TV. Also executive produced by Anthony Hemingway, Kris Jenner, Alexis Martin Woodall, Eric Kovtun, Scott Robertson, Nissa Diederich. Hulu will debut the All's Fair series streaming on Hulu starting in fall 2025. Stay tuned for the final date.
